Description: Ostracon, section (three fragments joined) of the body of a brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved and spotted with a dark-brown resinous substance, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing an account of wine.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.111-112)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36326) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36326)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 123 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
